name: Sauerbraten
description: A traditional German pot roast, usually of beef (or sometimes pork, lamb, or mutton), marinated before slow-cooking as pot roast. The meat is tenderized and imbued with a complex sour-sweet flavor from the marinade, containing vinegar, wine, and spices.
steps: Marinate the beef roast in a mixture of red wine, vinegar, onions, carrots, and spices for 2-3 days.
Remove the beef from the marinade, pat dry, and brown in hot oil in a heavy pot.
Strain the marinade and add it to the pot with the beef.
Add crushed ginger snaps to thicken and sweeten the sauce.
Simmer the roast slowly until it is tender.
Slice and serve the roast with the sauce poured over it.
tips: Make sure the meat is completely submerged in the marinade.
Turn the meat in the marinade once a day for even flavoring.
The longer the meat marinates, the more flavorful it will be.
